The game is in a decent state at the time of writing this (April 29th, 2022) and I still enjoy it. As long as you don't care too much about winning as either side, can put up with some sweat at higher levels, and generally remember that this is just a game. It's fine if you get a loss, or die early because we are all human after all. However, I will say that at higher ranks there are many many cheaters and bots that are still an issue. Until the cheater issue is fixed I can't recommend this game fully, but if you can ignore that part and understand that it will happen sometimes it is still a fun game.

This game is great, once you KNOW what you're doing, once you've invested the time to get all the perks and the teachables, learn the mechanics, and even then, there are plenty of bugs with the game. 

This game is NOT very friendly to new players. It takes a lot of time and investment to be able to play the game freely. Until then a lot of perks are locked behind tens and hundreds of games worth of points, and even locked behind DLC to obtain perks that are meta. 

IF you have time to invest into this game, and a bit of extra money to put into getting the perks you need to compete effectively at the red ranks, then go ahead and get this game. 

If you want a casual experience that you can hop on every now and then, not get screwed over because of silly bugs, or being at a disadvantage because you didnt buy a £5 DLC to get a certain character for their perks, then I recommend giving this game a miss for now, but keep an eye on it. Maybe in the future the developers will realise this games potential if they fix some of the core issues with the game. 

Also, Moris and Keys have 0 place in this game whatsoever, that alone could've been my reasoning.

It's a really great game with a lot to learn... just wish the DLCs were less expensive.
Got all the DLCs during the summer sale (or is it the 3rd anniversary sale?)
The game still lets you slowly grind the non-licensed characters though so you can go for a F2P grind.
The leveling up mechanic is also a huge grind, but the game itself is addictive enough that you'll find yourself grinding anyway

Big recommend (especially because the game still has a lot to improve and I can't wait for dedicated servers and other QoL changes coming our way)

Dead by daylight to me is a 10 out 10 game. It's not perfect and has a bunch of balance issues from time to time. The reason I love it so much is it's easy to play, but hard to master gameplay loop. The devs are willing to give updates to things that some players wouldn't think about. Quality of life and improvements to older perks. They have live streams and care about the community. Dedicated servers and caring about consoles players. Even a free to play phone version that is coming this year. All I want them to do is make all the killer viable for higher tier play. Add something else to do on the maps to extend the game length because rushing gens is always allowing me to rank up which is wrong.

Dead by Daylight is an asymmetrical 4 vs 1 multiplayer horror game.
One player is a Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors who are trying to escape.
To escape the survivors have to repair 5 generators to open the 2 exit doors. The killer has to kill the survivors by finding them and hit them down and hang them on a hook. A survivor can be hooked twice, beeing hooked a third time is deadly.
The killer plays in first person while the survivors play in third person.
As of writting there are currently 35 Maps, 22 Killers and 24 survivors.
There are famous Killers from movies in the list, like Freddy Krueger or Michael Myers. Same goes for the survivor side, there are survivors like Ash from Evil Dead Series or Laurie Strode.
From playing games you will receive Bloodpoints. Those Bloodpoints can be used to level up your character and unlock items, offerings and perks in the Bloodweb.
After reaching level 50 you can prestige, meaning you will reset everything you unlocked for your character and you will receive a bloody skin version for your character. You can prestige 3 times.
For people who like to customize their characters, Dead by Daylight has an ingame store for cosmetics and a battle pass.
The game also features crossplay with Playstation players since a while.
Dead by Daylight was released in 2016, so graphics has become a bit dated. However, the developers have started to update the graphics also in terms of the new console generation.
The playerbase is more or less stable around 40,000 concurrent players on Steam.
I think Dead by Daylight is the only asymmetrical multiplayer which is good so far. Even so if the latest update changed the animations and HUD for the worst from my point of view. Other negative aspects of the game are the weird hitboxes and the toxic behavior of some people.
Overall Dead by Daylight is an addictive game and delivers fun for many hours and still gets new content.

Sounds 9/10
Graphics 8/10
Gameplay 9/10
Atmosphere 10/10

I came back to this game after a long break. A LOT of things have improved since I last played. The animations for fixing the generators and opening the chests look great. It's not just some random rubbing or rummaging anymore. I really love the reworks on the maps and the thing on the side that shows how many times your team has been hooked. It's nice that you can buy things like characters with blood shards now that used to be blocked by a pay wall. I gave this a negative review before due to the glitches and everything being locked behind a paywall. However, after seeing all of the new updates and fun DLC concepts, I can say I enjoy this game again. It gets a bit repetitive but it's fun to play with friends.

Scary please nerf Frddy

I have played this game since beta and watched it develop and always enjoy the constant addition of content. Content added of new maps, killers and survivors added throughout the year, each year since it's release. The game allows you to be very versatile with your play style and have a wide rage of characters to choose from and starting perks to help you along the way. The ranking system is helpful to place you with people of your same skill set and the more you try to help others and complete tasks the more points you will retrieve. Solo play and playing a game with four friends can be fun and I enjoy the option of being able to murder your friends if you have more than a four person. Overall I find this game enjoyable and it is great to get a good spook on once in a while. I would recommend this game. But not if you tend to get scared easily and not enjoy the frights of killers chasing your booty.
The community isn't as bad as it may seem, they are some pretty cool people on here.  And, the game is extremely fun every once in a while.
